intro: Peucedanum chabraei, commonly known as the Kashmiri cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Peucedanum chabraei is often found in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
